channel.title: Tech on Nathan Laundry's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Tech on Nathan Laundry's Blog

item.title: Execute shell commands from inside Vim
item.description:
Vim has some really useful but lesser known features that can be really useful when creating temporary shell scripts. In this tech quickie post, I use Vim :'<,'>! syntax to help me quickly define an entire project in Taskwarrior - a CLI for task and project management.

Visually Select a Set of Lines

In my case, I was setting a series of tasks to port my docker server from Ubuntu to Debian - a subset of the task are listed below.

item.title: Turn GPT-4 Into your Personal Literature Review Bot
item.description:
ðŸ‘‹ Hey Friends,

Getting into a new field of research requires reading dozens of landmark and seminal papers to understand that fieldâ€™s foundations. This usually involves the manual process of searching key-words on google scholar, finding papers, polling friends, advisors, colleagues, and other experts for the most important papers. Itâ€™s an ad-hoc process that can take months.

Even more time intensive is conducting a proper, methodical, literature review. Establishing a method, identifying the correct keywords, finding the right databases - itâ€™s difficult but vital work.

item.title: ChatGPT is my Writing Coach and Editor: Here's How
item.description:
ðŸ’¡ Truly great writing, the kind that moves us, comes from lived human experiences. This will always be the domain of Sapiens. â€” A trust me bro statement by Nathan Laundry

ChatGPT doesnâ€™t have its own stories to share, but it excels at finding mistakes in the ways I write about mine! Thatâ€™s why ChatGPT and I make a great team. I bring real stories and ChatGPT helps me convey them effectively.
